com.brightcove.commons.applications
Class FTPUploader

java.lang.Object
  com.brightcove.commons.system.commandLine.CommandLineProgram
      com.brightcove.commons.applications.FTPUploader

public class FTPUploader
extends CommandLineProgram

Utility class to upload files to an FTP server. Includes logic to thread the upload and retry if the request takes too long.

Author:
three4clavin

Constructor Detail

FTPUploader

public FTPUploader()

Default constructor. Not intended to be called by other classes/objects - for command line use mainly.

FTPUploader

public FTPUploader(java.lang.String serverName,
                   java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password,
                   java.lang.Boolean skipTransfer,
                   java.lang.Boolean removeSource,
                   java.lang.Boolean passiveTransfer,
                   java.lang.Long uploadTimeoutMillis,
                   java.lang.Boolean debug)

Constructor specifying everything except server port (assumes port 21).

Parameters:
serverName - Server host name or ip address to connect to
username - Username to connect with
password - Password to connect with
skipTransfer - Skip transfer (usually used for testing)
removeSource - Remove local file after uploading
passiveTransfer - Use passive transfer mode if true instead of active
uploadTimeoutMillis - Time in milliseconds to timeout a request if it hasn't completed
debug - Verbose debugging messages on or off

serverPort - Server port to connect to

password - Password to connect with
skipTransfer - Skip transfer (usually used for testing)
removeSource - Remove local file after uploading
passiveTransfer - Use passive transfer mode if true instead of active
uploadTimeoutMillis - Time in milliseconds to timeout a request if it hasn't completed
debug - Verbose debugging messages on or off

Method Detail

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

Main command line execution. This should not be called from another class/object - it is meant only as a command line bootstrap.

Accepted command line arguments:

  • --config-file: Path to config file with FTP options
  • --timeout-retries: Number of times to retry a timed out request

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments

run

public void run(java.lang.String[] args)
Description copied from class: CommandLineProgram

Parses the command line arguments and kills program execution if required arguments aren't provided.

Overrides:
run in class CommandLineProgram
Parameters:
args - Arguments passed in on the command line

doUpload

public void doUpload()
              throws java.lang.Exception

Performs the upload. Actual upload is done by a background thread, so it can be killed if it runs for too long.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If thread is interrupted (mainly if upload times out)
